thread.title: Ken Starr 'lined up for job in the Trump administration'
thread.title_full: Ken Starr 'lined up for job in the Trump administration'

title: Ken Starr 'lined up for job in the Trump administration'
text: show ad Controversial lawyer Ken Starr who launched the impeachment of Clinton and quit as Baylor president after sexual assault scandal 'is lined up for a job in the Trump administration' Former Baylor President Ken Starr is the former independent counsel who investigated Bill Clintonâ€™s sexual activities during his presidency He's been put on the shortlist for the role as ambassador-at-large for President Donald Trump's Office of Religious Freedom The job promotes religious freedom and monitors religious persecution Other candidates reportedly on the shortlist are Ben Carson's former faith adviser Johnnie Moor Jr, and Hudson Institute human rights lawyer Nina Shea Starr served as president of Baylor from 2010 to 2016, when he was demoted after a report found that administrators mishandled sexual abuse cases
